Articles.Content:
Now that we have radiative heating and Kerbol is finally a dangerous place to go near, it would be interesting to have a deployable part capable of protecting the vessel for some time.

Remember this underrated movie?

![Sunshine.jpg](http://www.mvdw-productions.net/movies/images/Sunshine.jpg)

Something lightweight and shiny. Procedural Parts' can make the looks, but the function does not exist.

Some of the problems Kerbol causes, check them out here.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125220-Exploration-of-Kerbol-and-heat-management-near-it](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125220-Exploration-of-Kerbol-and-heat-management-near-it)

We'd basically need a solar reflector. Ideally, a procedurally sized shield-like one, but a set of other shapes would come in handy, too.

Imagine a body close to Kerbol as Ablate is.

![ablatelw_1.png](http://s12.postimg.org/nbvezu6j1/ablatelw_1.png)

You'd need a decent solar protection to survive. This opens whole new possibilities for KSP. Solar shield EVA suits for couple of minutes of walking around would also be a nice addon.
you could try to modded the Deployable Phased Array Microwave Transceiver from KSP Interstellar Extended to act like a heat shield. It is huge.
I will look into it, thanks.
